definition: to draw a lesson (from a setback)

sentences.english: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.
sentences.chinese: 都恆心遵守使徒的教訓，彼此交接，擘餅，祈禱。

sentences.english: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.
sentences.chinese: 到了節期，耶穌上殿裏去教訓人。

sentences.english: The first lesson learned is that lessons can be learned.
sentences.chinese: 第一個條件是我們可以吸取經驗教訓。

sentences.english: I ask what the episode taught him.
sentences.chinese: 我問這段插曲給了他什麼教訓。

sentences.english: Draw lessons from mistake,don't make same mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 從錯誤中吸取教訓，不要重犯舊錯。

sentences.english: The stories must have a morel or a lesson in them.
sentences.chinese: 這些故事必須有一個莫雷爾或在他們的教訓。

sentences.english: I want to all don't pick trouble to anything, also hands -off or teach other people.
sentences.chinese: 我要對任何事都不挑毛病，也不干涉或教訓別人。

sentences.english: I've already schooled you once tonight, homeboy.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我已經教訓過你一次了，臭小子。

sentences.english: But we have learned from these efforts.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我們從中吸取了教訓。

sentences.english: So what are the lessons of the rare earth fracas?
sentences.chinese: 那麼這場稀土紛爭給人什麼的教訓？

sentences.english: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.
sentences.chinese: 利慕伊勒王的言語，是他母親教訓他的真言。

sentences.english: Xu master know that very angry after the second day go to teach them.
sentences.chinese: 徐老爺得知後很生氣欲第二天去去教訓他們。

sentences.english: The lessons of these losers deserve our reflection.
sentences.chinese: 這些失敗者的教訓值得所有媒體反思。

sentences.english: 21They went to Capernaum, and when the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.
sentences.chinese: 到了迦百家，耶穌就在安息日進了會堂教訓人。

sentences.english: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us?
sentences.chinese: 他們回答說，你全然生在罪孽中，還要教訓我們嗎。

sentences.english: So that will be our new intro to the lessons from hereon .
sentences.chinese: 所以，這將會是我們新的介紹，向教訓，在此。

definition: to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
to hit/to strike/to attack/to crack down on sth/blow/(psychological) shock/percussion (music)
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
(in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
